page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The area lies on the southern flank of the{Mendip Hills,}between the market towns of{Wells and Shepton Mallet.}The post-war suburbs of eastern Wells extend into the study area, but the other settlements are{picturesque {hamlets}built in attractive local stone, often with distinctive{pantile {roofs.}Indeed, one of its outstanding characteristics is the{variety of {landscape}found in such a small area. In the south,the{Sheppey Valley}within 2km, changes from a dramatic tree-lined{gorge}into a broad, gentle valley of meadowland; rising to the north is a wooded ridge which provides an attractive backdrop to the villages of{Dulcote, Dinder and Croscombe.}In the N.W, however, post-war growth by Wells has raised{conservation}issues. To the N.E., an ancient beach now 150m O.D. gives fine{panoramas of Somerset.
